title: Is there a reason set_executable only sets S_IXUSR?
body:
I was surprised to find that set_executable only made things executable for the owner.

As it is, I may end up doing this (from cuda.py) in my install step:

```
        chmod = which('chmod')
        chmod('+x', runfile)
```

This is more like what I thought set_executable would do:

```
diff --git a/lib/spack/llnl/util/filesystem.py b/lib/spack/llnl/util/filesystem.py
index 4cf9916..4d1a287 100644
--- a/lib/spack/llnl/util/filesystem.py
+++ b/lib/spack/llnl/util/filesystem.py
@@ -368,8 +368,11 @@ def traverse_tree(source_root, dest_root, rel_path='', **kwargs):


 def set_executable(path):
-    st = os.stat(path)
-    os.chmod(path, st.st_mode | stat.S_IEXEC)
+    mode = os.stat(path).st_mode
+    mode |= stat.S_IXUSR
+    mode |= stat.S_IXGRP
+    mode |= stat.S_IXOTH
+    os.chmod(path, mode)


 def remove_dead_links(root):
```
